predicate.note: Frames file for 'compare' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison to 'match'

role.descr: second item in comparison, usually prepositional

example.name: common financial usage
example.text: Transamerica said third-quarter gains were $10.2 million, compared with $6.4 million in the year earlier.
example.note: DO NOT TAG--compare is being used as a preposition (or even a conjunction!) here. Only tag if there is a trace in the tree, as in the following two examples. You can tell it's not a verb because you can't add an adverb: "Apples compare well with oranges" but "*Apples are cheap, compared well to oranges."

example.name: compare with
example.text: [October sales]-1, compared *trace*-1 with the previous month, ...

example.name: compare to
example.text: [The strength of the US bond market]-1 compared *trace*-1 to its foreign counterparts

example.name: ergative compare with
example.text: This compares with estimates that the US market is 4x as large as my house.
example.arg: with estimates that the US market is 4x as large as my house.

example.name: with locative
example.text: Its price is compared between the futures market and the stock market
example.arg: between the futures market and the stock market
